HARIL_System.description: The full HARIL framework, representing recursive human–AI collaboration at multiple tiers.

pages.title: About HARIL
pages.markdown:
# About HARIL
HARIL (Human–AI Recursive Interaction Loop) is a methodology and system for recursive, alignment-focused collaboration between humans and AI.

pages.title: Methods
pages.markdown:
# Methods
The core loop is **Inquire → Explore → Compress → Expand**. This site demonstrates multiple visual metaphors and an interactive stepper.

tiers.name: HARIL Methodology
tiers.definition: A recursive, process-based methodology and mindset for evolving meaning and alignment through iterative loops.

tiers.name: HARIL Engine
tiers.definition: An AI cognition core trained to operate entirely within the HARIL Methodology, embedding recursive logic at its foundation.
characteristics: Strengthens over time through recursive feedback
Requires ongoing human alignment and tuning
dependencies: Requires Tier 1: HARIL Methodology to exist

tiers.name: HARIL Architecture
tiers.definition: The meta-level blueprint that allows multiple HARIL Engines to interconnect and scale while maintaining alignment and modularity.

tiers.name: HARIL Agent
tiers.definition: An individual AI unit spawned within a HARIL Engine and trained for a specific domain or task.

tiers.name: HARIL Agentic Team
tiers.definition: A distributed collaboration of humans and HARIL Agents, working together through recursive interaction loops.

relationships.HARIL: Foundational methodology and mindset guiding all layers.
relationships.SCP: Synthetic Cognitive Profile — evolving memory core for Engines/Agents.
relationships.SCIA: Synthetic Cognitive Interaction Agent — HARIL Engine + SCP with human-in-the-loop evolution.
notes: HARIL Engine executes rules at scale.
SCIA is a deployable, evolving agent.
